revised_title: Effects of Glacier Flow on Bedrock Stress: The Role of Elastic Humps
tldr: The authors investigate the stress patterns and associated strength variations developed in an unjointed isotropic elastic bedrock hummock due to the non-uniform pressure distribution at the ice-bed contact. They found that the down-glacier flanks of these hummocks are particularly susceptible to failure, which helps explain the asymmetric forms observed in bedrock hummocks revealed beyond the retreating margins of modern glaciers. The study suggests that large-scale fracturing due to glacially induced stresses in bedrock is a major mechanism of glacial erosion.
